REMEDY: Check fuel system for leaks. Fill fuel tank. Clean dirty lines, strainers or fuel valves.
Leave ignition off and mixture control in Idle Cut-Off, open throttle and unload engine by cranking for a few seconds. Turn ignition switch on and proceed to start in a normal manner.
Clean and adjust or replace spark plugs.
Check with electric tester, and replace any defective wires.
Replace with charged battery.
Clean points. Check internal timing of magnetos.
Disconnect fuel line and check fuel flow.
Drain carburetor and fuel lines.
Check oil screens for metal particles. If found, complete overhaul of the engine may be indicated.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Idle Properly
REMEDY: Adjust mixture.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Idle Properly
REMEDY: Tighten all connections in the induction system. Replace any parts that are defective.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Idle Properly
REMEDY: Adjust throttle stop to obtain correct idle.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Idle Properly
REMEDY: Check condition of piston rings and valve seats.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Idle Properly
REMEDY: Check entire ignition system.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Idle Properly
REMEDY: Adjust fuel pressure.

PROBABLE CAUSE: Mixture too rich (indicated by sluggish operation, red exhaust flame at night. Extreme cases indicated by black smoke from exhaust)
REMEDY: Readjustment of carburetor by authorized personnel is indicated.

PROBABLE CAUSE: Mixture too lean (indicated by overheating or backfiring)
REMEDY: Check fuel lines for dirt or other restrictions. Readjustment of carburetor by authorized person- nel is indicated.
Tighten all connections. Replace defective parts.
Clean and gap or replace spark plugs.
Fill tank with fuel of recom- mended grade.

PROBABLE CAUSE: Magneto breaker points not working properly
REMEDY: Clean points. Check internal timing of magnetos.
Check wire with electric tester. Replace defective wire.
Replace connectors on spark plug wire.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Develop Full Power
REMEDY: Tighten all connections and replace defective parts.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Develop Full Power
REMEDY: Adjust throttle lever.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Develop Full Power
REMEDY: Check strainer, gage and flow at the fuel inlet.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Develop Full Power
REMEDY: Examine air scoop and remove restrictions.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Develop Full Power
REMEDY: Drain and refill tank with recom- mended fuel.

TROUBLE: Failure of Engine to Develop Full Power
REMEDY: Tighten all connections. Check system with tester. Check ignition timing.
Replace or repair mount.
Install new mounting bushings.
Check compression.
Fill to proper level with recom- mended oil.

PROBABLE CAUSE: Air lock or dirt in relief valve
REMEDY: Remove and clean oil pressure relief valve.

PROBABLE CAUSE: Leak in suction line or pressure line
REMEDY: Check gasket between accessory housing and crankcase.
See High Oil Temperature in Trouble column.
Replace.

PROBABLE CAUSE: Stoppage in oil pump intake passage
REMEDY: Check line for obstruction. Clean suction strainer.
Check air inlet and outlet for deformation or obstruction.
Fill to proper level with specified oil.
Replace with oil conforming to specifications.
Remove and clean oil strainers.
Usually caused by worn or stuck rings.
Examine sump for metal par- ticles. If found, overhaul of engine is indicated.
Replace gage.
Fill tank with oil conforming to specifications.
Check sump for metal particles.
Install new rings.
Install new rings.

PROBABLE CAUSE: Failure of rings to seat (new nitrided cylinders)
REMEDY: Use mineral base oil. Climb to cruise altitude at full power and operate at 75% cruise power setting until oil consumption stabilizes.
